name: Certificate of Undergraduate Study in Advanced Manufacturing

Certificate of Undergraduate Study in Ad: Certificate of Undergraduate Study in Advanced Manufacturing The CUGS in Advanced Manufacturing will prepare graduates to gain employment in the advanced manufacturing sector both in New Jersey and nationwide. This CUGS will allow students to increase the depth and breadth of knowledge in the advanced manufacturing area, including additive manufacturing (3D printing). Students must complete four (4) courses (12 sch), of which no more than two (2) courses (6 sch) may be counted towards a degree or another certificate. Administrating program faculty may approve or add courses to the list.

courses.subject: ME
courses.title: Quality and Reliability in Design and Manufacture

courses.subject: ME
courses.title: Introduction to Additive Manufacturing and Characterization

notes: Total Required Credits for the Program: 12 s.h. Program Coordinator/Advisor Contact Information Anu Osta Associate Teaching Professor & CUGS Advisor Rowan Hall 856.256.5252 osta@rowan.edu
